title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Nehemiah chapter 7 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Nehemiah Chapter 7.

questions.question: Who was given charge over Jerusalem because he was a faithful man and feared God above many?
questions.correctAnswer: Hanani
questions.explanation: Nehemiah gave charge over Jerusalem to his brother Hanani because he was a faithful man and feared God above many, as stated in Nehemiah 7:2.

questions.question: What instruction did Nehemiah give regarding the gates of Jerusalem?
options: Let the gates be opened only after the sun is hot
Keep the gates open all night
Close the gates only on Sabbath
questions.correctAnswer: Let the gates be opened only after the sun is hot
questions.explanation: Nehemiah instructed that the gates of Jerusalem should not be opened until the sun was hot, and while the porters stand by, they should shut the doors and bar them, as seen in Nehemiah 7:3.

questions.question: What was the condition of the city after the wall was built?
options: The city was large and great but the people were few and houses were not built
The city was small with many people
The city was large and fully populated
questions.correctAnswer: The city was large and great but the people were few and houses were not built
questions.explanation: Nehemiah described the city as large and great, but the people were few and the houses were not built, according to Nehemiah 7:4.

questions.question: Who did Nehemiah find a register of genealogy for?
options: Those who came up at the first from captivity
questions.correctAnswer: Those who came up at the first from captivity
questions.explanation: Nehemiah found a register of the genealogy of those who came up at the first from captivity, as stated in Nehemiah 7:5.

questions.question: Who was the king of Babylon that carried away those who returned to Jerusalem and Judah?
questions.correctAnswer: Nebuchadnezzar
questions.explanation: Nebuchadnezzar was the king of Babylon who carried away the people into captivity, as noted in Nehemiah 7:6.

questions.question: Who is NOT listed as one of those who came up with Zerubbabel?
questions.correctAnswer: David
questions.explanation: David is not listed in the group who came up with Zerubbabel; Nehemiah 7:7 lists Jeshua, Nehemiah, Azariah, Mordecai and others, but not David.

questions.question: How many children of Parosh returned according to the census?
questions.explanation: The children of Parosh numbered two thousand two hundred seventy and two, as recorded in Nehemiah 7:8.

questions.question: Which group had the greatest number mentioned among the children?
questions.correctAnswer: The children of Senaah
questions.explanation: The children of Senaah numbered three thousand nine hundred and thirty, which is the greatest number listed, as per Nehemiah 7:38.

questions.question: True or False: The singers were descendants of Asaph.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The singers were the children of Asaph, as stated in Nehemiah 7:44.

questions.question: True or False: The Nethinims were children of Solomon's servants.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The Nethinims included the children of Solomon's servants, according to Nehemiah 7:57-60.

questions.question: What was the total number of the whole congregation mentioned?
questions.explanation: The whole congregation numbered forty-two thousand three hundred and sixty, as recorded in Nehemiah 7:66.

questions.question: How many singing men and women were there?
questions.explanation: There were two hundred forty-five singing men and women, as stated in Nehemiah 7:67.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The Tirshatha gave to the treasure a thousand drams of gold, fifty basons, and ______ priests' garments.
questions.correctAnswer: five hundred thirty
questions.explanation: The Tirshatha gave five hundred thirty priests' garments along with gold and basons, as mentioned in Nehemiah 7:70.

questions.question: Who were not allowed to eat of the most holy things until a priest with Urim and Thummim stood up?
options: Those who were reckoned as polluted
questions.correctAnswer: Those who were reckoned as polluted
questions.explanation: Those who sought their register but were not found were considered polluted and not allowed to eat of the most holy things until a priest with Urim and Thummim arose, according to Nehemiah 7:64-65.

questions.question: True or False: When the seventh month came, the children of Israel were in their cities.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The text states that when the seventh month came, the children of Israel were in their cities, as described in Nehemiah 7:73.

medium.title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Nehemiah Chapter 7 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling to maintain integrity in their work and leadership. Based on Nehemiah 7, what biblical truth would you share about trustworthy leadership?
options: Trustworthy leaders fear God and are faithful, setting example for others
Leaders should prioritize personal gain over obedience
Leadership is about power and control, not faithfulness
questions.correctAnswer: Trustworthy leaders fear God and are faithful, setting example for others
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:2 highlights Hanani and Hananiah as faithful men who feared God above many, showing that true leadership is grounded in faith and integrity. This teaches us the value of godly character in leadership (Nehemiah 7:2, 7:3, 7:5).

questions.question: How does Nehemiah 7 teach us about the importance of spiritual discipline and order in the life of a community?
options: By appointing porters, singers, Levites, and setting gate watches to maintain order
By allowing everyone to do as they please without structure
By focusing only on building physical walls without spiritual roles
By neglecting the organization of the people
questions.correctAnswer: By appointing porters, singers, Levites, and setting gate watches to maintain order
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:1-3 describes the appointment of various groups and the setting of watches at the gates, showing the value of spiritual discipline and order for community stability and worship (Nehemiah 7:1-3, 7:73).

questions.question: What does Nehemiah 7 teach us about the importance of remembering and honoring our spiritual heritage and genealogy?
options: Remembering genealogy helps preserve identity and God's faithfulness
Genealogy is irrelevant to faith and community
Genealogy only matters for social status
questions.correctAnswer: Remembering genealogy helps preserve identity and God's faithfulness
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:5-6 emphasizes gathering genealogies to remind the people of their heritage and God's providence in bringing them back from captivity, underscoring the importance of spiritual roots and identity (Nehemiah 7:5-6, 7:61).

questions.question: A believer feels overwhelmed by the small number of people in their church community. According to Nehemiah 7, what biblical encouragement could you offer?
options: God can rebuild and bless even when the numbers are few
Only large communities matter to God
questions.correctAnswer: God can rebuild and bless even when the numbers are few
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:4 shows that although the city was large, the people were few and houses not built, yet God worked through them. This teaches perseverance and trust in God's timing (Nehemiah 7:4, 7:66-67).

questions.question: How does this passage teach us about stewardship and generosity in supporting God's work?
options: Believers gave gold, silver, and garments willingly to support the work
questions.correctAnswer: Believers gave gold, silver, and garments willingly to support the work
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:70-72 records the generous gifts from chief fathers and people for the temple work, illustrating the value of joyful, sacrificial giving in God's service (Nehemiah 7:70-72, 7:1).

questions.question: What biblical principle about prayerful leadership can be drawn from Nehemiah setting up gate watches and ordering the gates to remain closed until the sun was hot?
options: Leadership involves wise planning and spiritual vigilance
Leaders should act impulsively without preparation
questions.correctAnswer: Leadership involves wise planning and spiritual vigilance
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:3 shows him instructing the people to watch the gates carefully and close them until the heat of the day, demonstrating careful, prayerful leadership that balances spiritual and practical concerns (Nehemiah 7:3, 7:1-2).

questions.question: According to Nehemiah 7, what is the significance of appointing specific groups such as singers, porters, Levites, and Nethinims in the community?
options: Each group serves a distinct role contributing to worship and community order
Only priests matter in the community
Spiritual duties should be done only by leaders
questions.correctAnswer: Each group serves a distinct role contributing to worship and community order
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:44-56 lists various groups with their roles, showing how diverse gifts and responsibilities build a healthy worship community and demonstrate service to God (Nehemiah 7:1, 7:44-56).

questions.question: True or False: Nehemiah 7 shows that genealogical records were crucial for maintaining purity in the priesthood and community membership.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:61-65 explains that some could not prove their lineage and were excluded from priestly duties until a priest with Urim and Thummim arose, emphasizing the importance of genealogical records for community purity (Nehemiah 7:61-65).

questions.question: How does Nehemiah 7 teach us about humility and contentment in rebuilding after hardship?
options: The people accepted their small numbers and incomplete houses but trusted God to rebuild
They demanded immediate perfection and success
They gave up due to difficulties
They focused on complaining about their situation
questions.correctAnswer: The people accepted their small numbers and incomplete houses but trusted God to rebuild
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:4 describes the city’s large size but few inhabitants and unfinished homes, yet the people persevered in rebuilding, showing humility and contentment in God’s timing (Nehemiah 7:4, 7:73).

questions.question: A friend struggles with faithfulness in small tasks. Based on Nehemiah 7, what biblical truth about faithfulness in service can you share?
options: Faithfulness in appointed roles like porters and singers supports the whole community
Only high-profile tasks matter for faithfulness
Small tasks are insignificant and can be ignored
Faithfulness is not important in service
questions.correctAnswer: Faithfulness in appointed roles like porters and singers supports the whole community
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:1 and 7:44-45 show that even porters and singers had appointed roles essential to worship and community life, teaching that faithfulness in any task honors God (Nehemiah 7:1, 7:44-45).

questions.question: How does Nehemiah 7 illustrate the importance of perseverance through trials in the life of believers?
options: The people returned from captivity and rebuilt despite hardships and few numbers
They gave up because of obstacles
Perseverance is not necessary for faith
questions.correctAnswer: The people returned from captivity and rebuilt despite hardships and few numbers
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:6-7 and 7:66-67 describe how the returned exiles, though few, persevered in rebuilding Jerusalem, showing that faithfulness through trials leads to restoration (Nehemiah 7:6-7, 7:66-67).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Nehemiah appointed his brother Hanani and Hananiah the ruler of the palace over Jerusalem because they were ______.
questions.correctAnswer: faithful men who feared God
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:2 states that Hanani and Hananiah were appointed because they were faithful men who feared God above many, highlighting the importance of godly character in leadership.

questions.question: True or False: According to Nehemiah 7, some priests were restricted from eating the most holy things until a priest with Urim and Thummim arose.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:65 explains that some priests who could not prove their genealogy were not allowed to eat the most holy things until a priest with Urim and Thummim stood up, showing the importance of proper priestly authority.

questions.question: What practical lesson about church fellowship and unity can we learn from the final verse of Nehemiah 7?
options: All groups—priests, Levites, porters, singers, Nethinims, and people—dwelled together in their cities in unity
Each group isolated themselves from others
Only priests lived in the city
questions.correctAnswer: All groups—priests, Levites, porters, singers, Nethinims, and people—dwelled together in their cities in unity
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:73 describes the entire community dwelling in their cities together, illustrating the biblical principle of fellowship and unity within the body of Christ.

questions.question: How does Nehemiah 7 encourage believers to approach stewardship of resources for God’s work?
options: Faithful giving from many supports the work and honors God
Giving is unnecessary for spiritual growth
Stewardship means keeping resources only for personal use
questions.correctAnswer: Faithful giving from many supports the work and honors God
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:70-72 shows that leaders and people alike contributed gold, silver, and garments for the temple, demonstrating that stewardship involves generous giving by the whole community (Nehemiah 7:70-72).

hard.title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Nehemiah Chapter 7.

questions.question: Who was appointed over Jerusalem because he was a faithful man who feared God above many?
questions.correctAnswer: Hanani
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:2 states that Hanani and Hananiah the ruler of the palace were given charge over Jerusalem because Hanani was a faithful man who feared God above many.

questions.question: According to Nehemiah 7, what instruction was given regarding the gates of Jerusalem?
options: Do not open the gates until the sun is hot
Open the gates only at dawn
Keep the gates open all night
Let the gates be open during the Sabbath
questions.correctAnswer: Do not open the gates until the sun is hot
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:3 instructs that the gates should not be opened until the sun is hot, and while the gatesmen stand by, they should shut and bar the doors.

questions.question: What was the state of the city after the wall was built, according to Nehemiah 7?
options: The city was large and great, but the people were few and houses were not built
The city was small and heavily populated
The city was fully rebuilt with many houses
questions.correctAnswer: The city was large and great, but the people were few and houses were not built
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:4 describes the city as large and great, but with few people and houses not built, highlighting the incomplete restoration.

questions.question: What motivated Nehemiah to gather the nobles, rulers, and people to be reckoned by genealogy?
options: God put it into Nehemiah's heart
questions.correctAnswer: God put it into Nehemiah's heart
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:5 shows that God inspired Nehemiah internally to gather the people and record their genealogies.

questions.question: Who led the first group that returned to Jerusalem from captivity, as listed in Nehemiah 7?
questions.correctAnswer: Zerubbabel
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:7 lists those who returned with Zerubbabel as the leader of the first group from captivity.

questions.question: Which group listed in Nehemiah 7 had the largest number of people returning to Jerusalem?
questions.correctAnswer: Children of Senaah
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:38 records that the children of Senaah numbered 3,930, the largest among the groups listed.

questions.question: What was the number of priests who returned with the children of Jeshua, as recorded in Nehemiah 7?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:39 states that the children of Jedaiah, from the house of Jeshua, numbered 973 priests.

questions.question: Which groups were specifically appointed and mentioned in Nehemiah 7:1 after the wall was built?
questions.correctAnswer: Porters, singers, and Levites
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:1 tells that after the wall was built, the porters, singers, and Levites were appointed.

questions.question: True or False: The Nethinims and Solomon's servants together numbered 392 according to Nehemiah 7.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:60 confirms that all the Nethinims and the children of Solomon's servants totaled 392.

questions.question: What was the consequence for priests who could not prove their genealogy, according to Nehemiah 7?
options: They were considered polluted and put from the priesthood
They were given a second chance to prove their lineage
They were appointed as Levites instead
They were allowed to serve without restriction
questions.correctAnswer: They were considered polluted and put from the priesthood
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:64 states that priests who could not find their register were considered polluted and excluded from priesthood.

questions.question: What special item did the Tirshatha say must be present before certain priests could eat of the most holy things?
questions.correctAnswer: Urim and Thummim
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:65 mentions the Tirshatha's declaration that no one should eat of the most holy things until a priest with Urim and Thummim stood up.

questions.question: What was the total number of the whole congregation, excluding servants and singers, as recorded in Nehemiah 7?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:66 gives the total congregation as 42,360 individuals.

questions.question: Which of these animals was NOT listed among those owned by the people in Nehemiah 7?
questions.correctAnswer: Elephants
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:68-69 lists horses, mules, camels, and asses, but elephants are not mentioned.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Nehemiah 7, the Levites mentioned were the children of _______, Kadmiel, and Hodevah.
questions.correctAnswer: Jeshua
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:43 identifies the Levites as the children of Jeshua, Kadmiel, and Hodevah.

questions.question: What was the role of the 'porters' mentioned in Nehemiah 7 and who were they descended from?
options: Gatekeepers descended from Shallum, Ater, Talmon, Akkub, Hatita, and Shobai
questions.correctAnswer: Gatekeepers descended from Shallum, Ater, Talmon, Akkub, Hatita, and Shobai
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:45 specifies that porters, or gatekeepers, were descended from those families.

theological.title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Nehemiah Chapter 7 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: Who was given charge over Jerusalem because he was faithful and feared God above many?
questions.correctAnswer: Hanani
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:2 states that Hanani, Nehemiah's brother, and Hananiah were given charge over Jerusalem because Hanani was a faithful man who feared God above many. This emphasizes the biblical principle of leadership marked by faithfulness and reverence to God (cf. Proverbs 3:5-6, Psalm 112:1, Hebrews 11:6, 1 Timothy 3:2).

questions.question: What instructions were given concerning the gates of Jerusalem after the wall was built?
options: Do not open the gates until the sun is hot and appoint watches at the gates
Keep the gates open all day for trade
Close the gates only at night
Open the gates at dawn and close them at sunset
questions.correctAnswer: Do not open the gates until the sun is hot and appoint watches at the gates
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:3 commands that the gates should not be opened until the sun is hot, and that the doors should be shut and barred while the watchmen stand guard, highlighting the importance of vigilance and protection of the holy city (see also Nehemiah 4:13-14, Psalm 127:1, Proverbs 4:23, Revelation 21:12).

questions.question: What was notable about the city of Jerusalem at the time of Nehemiah's leadership?
options: The city was large and great, but the people were few and the houses were not built
The city was small but densely populated
The city was fully restored with many houses
The city was uninhabited and desolate
questions.correctAnswer: The city was large and great, but the people were few and the houses were not built
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:4 notes that the city was large and great, yet the population was small and the houses were not built, reflecting the physical restoration that was underway but the social and demographic rebuilding that still needed to occur (cf. Ezra 9:9, Isaiah 54:2-3, Haggai 2:4-7, Acts 15:16-17).

questions.question: What motivated Nehemiah to gather the nobles, rulers, and people to be reckoned by genealogy?
options: God put it into his heart
He wanted to create a census for taxation
He sought to divide the land among tribes
He desired to appoint new leaders
questions.correctAnswer: God put it into his heart
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:5 states that God put it into Nehemiah's heart to gather the people to be counted by genealogy, showing divine initiative in preserving Israel's identity and covenant community (cf. Numbers 1:2-3, Ezra 2:59-63, Luke 3:23-38, Romans 9:4).

questions.question: Who were the captives carried away by Nebuchadnezzar that returned to Jerusalem and Judah?
options: The children of the province who were carried away
questions.correctAnswer: The children of the province who were carried away
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:6 identifies those returning as the children of the province who had been carried away by Nebuchadnezzar, emphasizing God's faithfulness in restoring His people from exile (cf. Jeremiah 29:10, Isaiah 43:5-6, Ezekiel 37:21-22, Luke 1:68-70).

questions.question: Which leader is NOT mentioned among those who came up with Zerubbabel?
questions.correctAnswer: Hanani
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:7 lists leaders who came with Zerubbabel, including Mordecai, Nehemiah, and Azariah, but Hanani is not mentioned here; he appears later as a leader appointed over Jerusalem (cf. Nehemiah 7:2, Ezra 2:2, Haggai 1:1, Zechariah 4:6-10).

questions.question: What role did the Nethinims serve according to Nehemiah 7?
questions.correctAnswer: Temple servants
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:46-60 lists the Nethinims among those who returned, identifying them as temple servants or helpers, a role also noted in 1 Chronicles 9:2 and Ezra 8:20, highlighting the organization of worship and sacred service (cf. Numbers 3:6-9, 1 Chronicles 9:22-27, Hebrews 9:1-5).

questions.question: What was the consequence for priests who could not show their genealogical records?
options: They were put from the priesthood and not allowed to eat the most holy things
They were given lesser duties in the temple
They were still allowed to serve but with restrictions
They were sent to another city
questions.correctAnswer: They were put from the priesthood and not allowed to eat the most holy things
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:64-65 explains that priests unable to prove their genealogical lineage were considered polluted and excluded from the priesthood and from eating the most holy offerings, underscoring the importance of purity and legitimate priestly descent (cf. Leviticus 21:17-23, Ezra 2:62-63, 2 Chronicles 15:8, Hebrews 7:11-14).

questions.question: How many people were counted in the whole congregation who returned to Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:66 states the total number of the congregation as forty-two thousand three hundred and sixty, illustrating God's providential preservation and restoration of Israel's people, a theme echoed in Numbers 1:45-46, Ezra 2:64, Acts 2:41, and Revelation 7:4.

questions.question: What types of animals are specifically mentioned as part of the people’s possessions?
questions.correctAnswer: Horses, mules, camels, and asses
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:68-69 lists horses, mules, camels, and asses among the possessions, reflecting the wealth and resources of the returned exiles, paralleling other Old Testament descriptions of valuable livestock (cf. Genesis 32:15, Deuteronomy 17:16, 1 Kings 4:28, Psalm 20:7).

questions.question: What did the chief fathers contribute to the work of rebuilding?
questions.correctAnswer: Gold, silver, and priests' garments
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:70-72 records that the chief fathers gave gold, silver, and priests' garments to the treasury for the work, demonstrating sacrificial giving and support for the temple and community restoration (cf. Exodus 35:20-29, 2 Corinthians 9:6-7, Malachi 3:10, Acts 4:34-37).

questions.question: In what condition did the people dwell when the seventh month came?
options: In temporary shelters near the wall
questions.correctAnswer: In their cities
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:73 states that all Israel dwelt in their cities at the coming of the seventh month, indicating a settled community life as God intended for His covenant people (cf. Joshua 21:41-42, Ezra 3:1, Leviticus 23:34, Acts 1:4).

questions.question: Which group was appointed alongside the porters, singers, and Levites after the wall was built?
questions.correctAnswer: The singers
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:1 mentions that porters, singers, and Levites were appointed after the wall was built, highlighting the organized worship and temple service as integral to the community's restoration (cf. 1 Chronicles 15:16, Psalm 100:2, Colossians 3:16, Ephesians 5:19).

questions.question: What was the role of the 'Tirshatha' in relation to the priests who lacked genealogical records?
options: He forbade them from eating the most holy things until a priest with Urim and Thummim stood up
He promoted them to leadership positions
He sent them away to other cities
He allowed them to serve without restrictions
questions.correctAnswer: He forbade them from eating the most holy things until a priest with Urim and Thummim stood up
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:65 shows the Tirshatha instructed that priests without genealogical proof should not eat the most holy things until a priest with Urim and Thummim appeared, emphasizing the sanctity and order required in priestly service (cf. Exodus 28:30, Leviticus 10:1-3, Numbers 27:21, Hebrews 5:1-4).

questions.question: The genealogical records found by Nehemiah were primarily for what purpose?
options: To confirm identity and legitimate lineage of the returning exiles
To establish a new political hierarchy
questions.correctAnswer: To confirm identity and legitimate lineage of the returning exiles
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 7:5-6 reveals that genealogical registers were used to confirm the identity and legitimate lineage of those returning from captivity, a vital step in restoring Israel's covenant community (cf. Ezra 2:59-63, Numbers 26:52-56, Luke 3:23-38, Romans 11:1-2).
